title: Pressure - pressure and force on two cylinders

content.question: Cylinders <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are connected by a narrow tube. The radius of Cylinder <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is less than the radius of Cylinder <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. A fluid is poured into the left cylinder until each cylinder is partially filled with fluid and the fluid comes to equilibrium, as shown. Which of the following correctly compares the forces <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and the pressures <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, exerted by the fluid on the bottom of Cylinders <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub 1 is greater than P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub 1 equals P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 1 is less than F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub 1 equals P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 1 is less than F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub 1 is less than P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 1 is less than F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub 1 equals P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
